summaries.title: Acorn Group honoured for HR excellence in Hospitality, Tourism and Leisure sector
summaries.summary: Acorn Group has been awarded for HR excellence in the Hospitality, Tourism, and Leisure sector at The Great HR Awards, organized by the Chartered Institute of Personnel Management (CIPM) Sri Lanka in partnership with Mercer. This recognition underscores the Group's dedication to progressive and people-centric human resource management practices.

summaries.title: Brown's 15 lead Saint Louis over Division-III Principia 114-33
summaries.summary: Dion Brown scored 15 points as Saint Louis dominated Division-III Principia with a decisive 114-33 victory on Sunday. The win showcased Saint Louis' strong performance throughout the game.

summaries.title: Brown's 15 lead Saint Louis over Division-III Principia 114-33
summaries.summary: The Saint Louis Billikens triumphed over Division-III Principia Panthers with a commanding score of 114-33, led by Dion Brown's 15 points. Kellen Thames contributed with 14 points and 11 rebounds, while Caleb White was the top scorer for Principia with 10 points. The victory improved the Billikens' record to 12-1.

summaries.title: City manager: Fort Worth’s economic growth continues to look strong
summaries.summary: Fort Worth City Manager Jay Chapa highlighted the city's robust economic growth during a panel discussion on December 16, 2025. He emphasized the positive outlook for the project pipeline in 2026, indicating continued development and investment in the area.

summaries.title: Ghana’s Evans Kyere-Mensah nominated to World Agriculture Forum Council
summaries.summary: Ghanaian agriculture expert Evans Kyere-Mensah has been nominated to the World Agriculture Forum (WAF) Council, a global platform aimed at influencing the future of agriculture. The nomination was announced in a letter from Michelle Dennis, the WAF's Director of Communications, dated December 3, 2025.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: Columbia secured a 90-82 victory over North Florida in Jacksonville, Florida, with Kenny Noland leading the team by scoring 27 points.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: Columbia secured a 90-82 victory over North Florida, led by Kenny Noland's impressive 27 points, shooting 9 of 15 overall and 4 of 7 from beyond the arc. Miles Franklin contributed 19 points and seven rebounds for the Lions, improving their record to 10-3.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: Columbia secured a 90-82 victory over North Florida, led by Kenny Noland's impressive performance, scoring 27 points. Noland shot 9 of 15 from the field, including 4 for 7 from beyond the arc, contributing significantly to the win.

summaries.title: China expands nuclear warhead manufacturing capacity, research finds
summaries.summary: China is significantly increasing its nuclear warhead manufacturing capacity, as revealed by an analysis of satellite imagery. The country is modernizing a network of secret facilities to produce warhead components, leading to a faster expansion of its nuclear stockpile than any other nation.

summaries.title: This Mini-ITX motherboard with four DDR5 slots could end up as rival to Nvidia's Petaflop AI mini PC
summaries.summary: Maxsun has introduced the MS-PC Farm 88601 Mini-ITX motherboard, which features four DDR5 slots, PCIe 5.0 expansion, and advanced power delivery. This motherboard is designed for high-performance computing and includes remote management capabilities, positioning it as a potential competitor to Nvidia's Petaflop AI mini PC.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: Columbia secured a 90-82 victory over North Florida in Jacksonville, Florida, with Kenny Noland leading the team by scoring 27 points.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: The Columbia Lions triumphed over the North Florida Ospreys with a score of 90-82, thanks to Kenny Noland's impressive 27 points. Miles Franklin contributed 19 points and seven rebounds for Columbia, while Kamrin Oriol and Kent Jackson led North Florida with 24 and 18 points, respectively.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: The Columbia Lions triumphed over the North Florida Ospreys with a score of 90-82, thanks to Kenny Noland's impressive 27 points. Miles Franklin contributed 19 points and seven rebounds for Columbia, while Kamrin Oriol and Kent Jackson led North Florida with 24 and 18 points, respectively.

summaries.title: Columbia wins 90-82 over North Florida
summaries.summary: The Columbia Lions secured a 90-82 victory over the North Florida Ospreys, with Kenny Noland leading the team with 27 points. Miles Franklin contributed 19 points and seven rebounds. Kamrin Oriol scored 24 points for North Florida, while Kent Jackson added 18. With this win, Columbia improved to 10-3, while North Florida suffered its sixth consecutive loss, dropping to 2-11.

summaries.title: The moon and sun figure big in 2026's lineup of cosmic wonders
summaries.summary: In 2026, the moon and sun will feature prominently in a series of cosmic events, including the first astronaut visit to the moon in over 50 years and multiple lunar landings by robotic missions, including Jeff Bezos' Blue Moon. The year will also see significant solar eclipses, with a total solar eclipse in August and a ring-of-fire eclipse in February. Additionally, three supermoons and a planetary parade will captivate skywatchers, while increased solar activity may lead to more auroras on Earth.

summaries.title: The moon and sun figure big in 2026's lineup of cosmic wonders
summaries.summary: In 2026, the moon and sun will dominate astronomical events, with the first crewed lunar mission in over 50 years and multiple robotic landings, including Jeff Bezos' Blue Moon. Notable celestial events include a ring-of-fire eclipse in February and a total solar eclipse in August. Additionally, three supermoons and a planetary parade featuring six planets will captivate skywatchers, while increased solar activity may enhance auroras on Earth.

summaries.title: Global Times: Overseas Audiences Experience The Charm Of Entertainment Products Imbued With Eastern Artistry
summaries.summary: The article discusses how Chinese entertainment products, including music, short dramas, and games, are set to reach global audiences by 2025, showcasing Eastern artistry and creating an immersive cultural experience. This initiative aims to promote a "Cool China" image internationally, highlighting the growing influence of Chinese culture in the global entertainment landscape.

summaries.title: Global Times: China's First Nuclear Medicine Demonstration Base Launches In Suzhou
summaries.summary: China has launched its first nuclear medicine demonstration base in Suzhou, established by the China National Nuclear Corporation (CNNC). This initiative aims to enhance clinical applications, foster innovation, and integrate the nuclear medicine industry chain.

summaries.title: Global Times: American Vlogger Discovers How A Self-Reliant China Warms People's Lives With Cutting-Edge Tech
summaries.summary: An American vlogger highlights China's focus on technological self-reliance as outlined in its 15th Five-Year Plan, showcasing advancements in AI and robotics that enhance daily life. The report emphasizes how these innovations contribute to a more trustworthy future for the world.
